Title: Retail Cashier - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Type: Part Time, Permanent
Start Date: As soon as possible
Language: English
Minimum Education: High School
Positions Available: 1
NOC Group: Cashiers (6611)
NOC Job Title: Cashier, Supermarket
Expires in 9 days
Expires: 2021-12-05
Posted: 2021-11-22
Last Updated: 2021-11-22
Job Location(s)
1475 Harvey Ave
Kelowna, British Columbia
V1Y 6E9, Canada
Job Description
Job Description
Reports to: Store Manager Employment Status: Permanent, Part-Time (approximately 15 to 20 hours per week)
Must be available to work a flexible schedule, that includes early mornings, and days Monday through Sunday.
Position Summary A Store Cashier acts as the company’s front line contact with customers, and plays an integral role in the customer experience.
Duties and Responsibilities • Assist customers in a manner that exceeds customer expectations • Manage transactions and the cash register with honesty and integrity * Assist customers with their shopping by scooping product for them *Assit with online customer orders * Cleaning lid tops, floors, shelves, and any other cleaning duties required
• Maintain a healthy and safe working environment • Assist with stock (in excess of 50 lbs.) • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications • Positive attitude and a pleasant disposition • Strong communication skills • Strong interpersonal skills • Detail-oriented • Ability to multi-task • Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and professionalism • Experience in a retail environment and cash handling is an asset • Superior time-management skills
How to Apply If you meet these requirements and are available to work a flexible schedule as mentioned above, please forward your resume by email.
No telephone calls please.No agency calls please.
Bulk Barn Foods Limited thanks all applicants for their interest in this opportunity. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
How to Apply
Expiring: Dec 05, 2021
Contact: John Pyziak
Email: store673@bulkbarn.ca

Title: Dispensary Cashier - Charlottetown, PE - Indeed.com
Description:
Murphy Healthcare is in the business of caring—we care about our communities, our clients, and our team members. Our family-owned and operated business has much more to offer than the paycheque alone. We are proud of the impact we have had in our communities for the past forty years. As we work to transform healthcare, delivering exceptional experiences for our clients, we’re looking for a Full-Time
Dispensary Cashier
aligned with our core values of
care, collaboration, and community
to join us on our mission.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Competitive wages
Group benefits including health, dental, insurance and disability, plus 100% coverage on most prescription drugs
Company Pension Plan with matching contributions up to 4% of annual salary
Leadership development program
Discounts with local businesses to help you save money, including home heating oil, restaurants, and island retailers
Subsidized fitness membership
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
You’re a people person who loves to smile
You have an excellent work ethic, proven ability to multi-task and communicate with clients in a pleasant manner.
Your attention to detail is above-average.
You have a passion for providing excellent service.
You’re comfortable and confident working in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple demands.
Experience working in a pharmacy or retail environment would be an asset
You’re reliable, efficient, and like being part of a team.
You love the flexibility of shift work, including days, evenings and weekends.
You have the physical ability to stand for extended periods of time; repetitive hand movements; bending/twisting; lift/move up to 25 pounds
HOW YOU’LL SPEND YOUR TIME
Accurately and efficiently completing all cash register transactions in a courteous, prompt and accurate manner.
Providing knowledgeable client care and customer service with respect to services and programs we offer our clients.
Processing third party billing and reconciliation
Perform daily counter filling, stock rotation, facing up and cleanliness of merchandise, fixtures, patient counselling areas and prescription drop-off and pick-up counters.
Maintain client and drug information files and gathering all necessary information.
Greeting clients, acknowledging waiting clients, and offering assistance.
Ensuring service is maintained at levels above industry standards.
Demonstrating effective two-way communication with customers, other staff members, and management.
Contributing to promoting a positive, friendly, safe, and healthy environment for all staff and clients.
Other duties assigned by the Supervisor, as required.
ARE YOU OUR NEXT TEAM MEMBER?
If you are professional, personable, patient, detail-oriented, and have the ability to stay calm in a variety of situations, please submit your cover letter and resume. We appreciate your interest in working with us. You’ll hear from one of our team members if we wish to continue the conversation with an interview.
Murphy Healthcare is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Major Activities
Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) and Company programs to ensure compliance to applicable laws and requirements; execute Company policies and standards

Engage customers on benefits of Rewards and complete enrollments

Title: Cashier (2 Vacancies) - Taber, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Reporting to the Grocery Manager, the Cashier is responsible for delivering world-class customer service, operating cash registers, and taking payment from customers, assisting with merchandising, and displaying packaged products, and maintaining cleanliness and housekeeping standards.
Qualifications
: Candidates should possess fundamental computer skills and POS knowledge, strong time management and math skills, and excellent internal and external customer service skills. Preference will be given to individuals who have experience with cash register operation (scanning), lottery service, cheque cashing procedures, and fresh product codes.
Attention to detail
Ability to adapt to new technology
High level of integrity and work ethic
Ability to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times
High flexibility with strong interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse environment
Positive attitude with a willingness to learn
Availability: Days, evenings, and weekends; 8:00 am to 10:00 pm
Internal candidates who apply by Tuesday, September 28, 2021, at 5:00 pm will be given first consideration, based on seniority, ability, and fitness to perform the work satisfactorily. The Internal Candidate Verification Form must be submitted.

Title: Winter 2021-22 - Food and Beverage Cashier - Banff, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Why Join Us?
We work and play in Canada’s most beautiful playground, Banff National Park, and you can too. Sunshine Village is the premier ski resort in Western Canada. If you want to be part of making our guests’ ski experience unforgettable and think a winter season skiing and riding on the best powder in the Rockies would be great too, then read on...
What’s in it for you?
A ridiculously cool life experience
Free ski pass for Sunshine Village and super deals at other resorts
A plethora of lively staff events all season long
Marvelous discounts on ski gear, food & drinks and transportation.
Food and Beverage Cashier
Position Details
Wage: $16.00 with Gratuities Included + $1.00 retention bonus
Hours: Full-time averaging around 40hrs/ week
Location: 1 Sunshine Village Access Road, Banff AB, T1L1J5
Description
Cashiers provide an outstanding experience for our guests. They are responsible for accepting payment transactions while creating a warm and welcoming environment. Keeping public spaces clean, well-stocked, and safe for guests is an integral part of this position. This is a physical position that requires some manual labour lifting and carrying.
Essential Functions
Provide excellent guest service
Operating the POS system to ring through the guests’ orders
Handle cash float, ensuring all money is accounted for and properly tracked
Accept payment transactions and complete accurate daily cash-outs
Maintain public spaces, including stocking supplies, cleaning, garbage removal, and Washrooms
Ability to answer guest queries about the mountain and operations in a friendly and efficient manner
Maintain a clean checkout area
Adherence to workplace safety and food safety/sanitation regulations
Other duties as assigned
Experience/Requirements
Passion for providing outstanding guest service
Previous cash handling experience with the ability to accurately manage a cash float
Energetic and self-motivated
Excellent communication, time management and teamwork skills
WHMIS training is an asset
Successful completion of Proserv alcohol serving certificate is required prior to commencement
This position includes a multi-area ski pass to Sunshine Village & other resorts, a staff event calendar for experiencing the Rockies, and free transportation from Banff and Canmore to Sunshine.
Can’t wait to get started? Great, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply online at skibanff.com/jobs/ and tell us why you’re the next awesome member of our team. Remember, we’re looking for people who will wow our guests, so start now and wow us. Sunshine Village is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity within our workplace.

Title: Cashier-Receptionist - Hamilton, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The Opportunity
Job Posting Number:
2021-416
Position:
Cashier-Receptionist
Location:
John St (Hamilton)
Reports to:
Supervisor, Payments and Collections
Business Unit:
Customer Service
Division:
Collections & Payments
Hours per Week:
35
Rate of Pay:
As per the Collective Agreement
Number of Openings:
1
Union:
*PWU
*
Open:
November 19, 2021
Close:
December 2, 2021
Position Purpose:
The Cashier-Receptionists are accountable for back-office data management, reception tasks, cashiering, mail room activities, and clerical functions for electric and water services.
Responsibilities:
Supports back office clerical tasks related to the setup, billing, collecting and payment of accounts
Processes account maintenance activities including: lawyer’s letters; landlord agreements, articles of incorporation, unoccupied accounts; resolving customer access issues; cashiering and payment processing, misapplied payments and cashier exception management; support and review equal payment plan report and make changes based on specific criteria; documentation and filing of customer requests and responses
Responds to reception calls and general customer inquiries, ensuring a high level of professionalism and in accordance with Alectra Utilities standards and OEB requirements
Supports mail room activities including inter-office mail delivery and prepping outbound items for mailing
Provides documentation and tracking related to clerical tasks
Performs user acceptance testing of system and procedural changes, documenting new and revised procedures to provide the efficient billing and customer services
Other duties as assigned
Understanding of Privacy Legislation, and its application within the department.
Responsible for demonstrating and maintaining a working knowledge and understanding of the Company’s safety policies and practices. Report any unsafe conditions or observed unsafe practices and make all efforts reasonable to work in accordance with The Ontario Health and Safety Act.
Skills & Qualifications:
Education & Specialized Knowledge*
Minimum of High School Education required
College diploma or University Degree in business or other related field and/or equivalent experience is an asset
Familiarity with regulations and bylaws governing electricity and water services
Experience
Experience in dealing with difficult customers, situations and moderately/complex problems
Experience in a customer service environment is an asset
Skills/Abilities/Competencies
Demonstrated MS Office experience with Word or Excel
Ability to handle/solve difficult situations
Ability to make quick and accurate decisions with minimal supervision that support the company procedures
Demonstrated Customer Service skills, working both with internal and external stakeholders
Proven keyboarding competency and accuracy is required
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to work from other locations as required as per guidelines within the Collective Agreement
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
How to Apply
If you would like to be considered for this position and meet the qualifications, please submit your resume by visiting our Careers page at https://www.alectra.com/careers.
Alectra is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a recruitment process that respects the dignity and independence of all candidates. Alectra will consult with all applicants who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicant's individual accessibility needs, to the point of undue hardship
.
In accordance with Alectra’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, as a condition of employment, successful job applicants must provide written proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 prior to their start date. This requirement is subject only to valid human rights-based requests for accommodation to the point of undue hardship.
We thank all applicants for their interest in a career with Alectra. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
